text: Q #16 | wmultiple Select Type | Award: 1 | Penalty: 0.0000 | Compiler Design Which of the following is/are true about Bottom-up parsing using stack? A. If there is no handle on the stack, then parser shifts to the next input. B. If there is a handle on the stack, then parser reduces the top of stack content to some non-terminal C. A conflict (Shift-reduce or Reduce-reduce) implies that parser does not know handle at the corresponding stage of parsing. D. A conflict (Shift-reduce or Reduce-reduce) implies that parser knows that handle but can not make a decision. I
